page.title: 13DAIRY FARMING
page.content: My dad is a dairy farmer. His name is Peter Redstone. Every morning he gets up at 5am, dresses and goes out to the milking parlour. He first makes sure everything is ready. He takes the clusters from the washup tub and fixes them to the milking machine. He goes out to round up the cows. This takes about ten minutes depending on which field the cows are in. There are forty Jersey cows in the herd and they go into the milking parlour six at a time. It takes five to ten minutes to milk six cows. When he has finished milking everything has to be washed and then put ready for the next milking. The cows are milked twice each day. After he has had his breakfast he mucks out all the manure from the calves pens. Sometimes he has to move the electric fences.
